Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: BIT INTERVAL OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identification number for eachinterval in which a bit is used in the wellbore.
Column Comment.3: DRILL BIT DETAIL TYPE: The type of additional detail that is captured in this row ofdata, such as metrics for measuring performance of a drill bit.
Column Comment.4: DETAIL OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for this detail record.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: AVERAGE VALUE: The average value for a detail record.
Column Comment.9: BASE DEPTH: The base depth that is relevant for this detail record about a bitinterval.
Column Comment.11: DRILL BIT DETAILCODE: A code that describes the condition of the type of detail forthis record. For example, some kinds of detail (sensors) may require condition codesof ON or OFF.
Column Comment.12: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.13: DETAIL DESCRIPTION: Narrative descriptive comments about this detail record.
Column Comment.14: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.15: END DATE: The last date this detail record is for.
Column Comment.16: END TIME: The last time that this detail record is for.
Column Comment.17: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.18: MAXIMUM VALUE: the maximum value for this detail record.
Column Comment.21: MINIMUM VALUE: The minimum value assocaited with this detail record.
Column Comment.24: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.25: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.26: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.27: START DATE: The start date that this record is for.
Column Comment.28: START TIME: The first time that this record is for.
Column Comment.29: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.30: TOP DEPTH: The top depth for which this record is relevant.
Column Comment.32: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.33: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.34: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.35: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.36: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.37: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.38: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
